title: IE Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Rev. Francis Litz, 91; Led Canonizing Effort
description: The Rev. Francis J. Litz, whose efforts led to the canonization of St. John Neumann, died Sunday, from complications of a stroke, at a health care center in Saratoga Springs, N.Y. He was 91 years old. Father Litz took up the cause of St. John Neumann, Philadelphia's fourth Roman Catholic bishop, in 1956 and served for more than 20 years as vice postulator for his canonization. In 1977. St. John Neumann became the first American male saint.

title: At Least 52 Die in Derailing Of an Express Train in India
description: An express train traveling from New Delhi to Calcutta derailed today, killing at least 52 people and injuring 64, Indian news reports said.

title: Death Toll in Blast Reaches 18
description: The 18th person has died of injuries sustained in a series of explosions at a plastics plant last month. Five people remained missing today. A construction worker hospitalized since the Oct. 23 explosions and fire at the Phillips Petroleum Company plant died Tuesday, said Jere Smith, a Phillips spokesman. The man, whose name was not released, worked for a subcontractor. The explosion injured 124 workers. The polyethylene plant accounted for almost 20 percent of the nation's production of plastic pellets used for goods like milk jugs and grocery bags.

title: California to Act on Temporary Tax for Quake Aid
description: The California Legislature will meet Thursday in a special session to vote on a temporary increase in the state sales tax to raise $800 million for earthquake relief and repairs.

title: For Borough President
description: Two candidates seek the borough presidency of Staten Island: the incumbent Democrat, Ralph Lamberti, and Representative Guy Molinari, who runs with Republican, Conservative and Right to Life backing.

title: Hearst to Cease Publication Of The Los Angeles Herald
description: The Hearst Corporation said today that it would cease publication of The Los Angeles Herald Examiner with Thursday's issue, leaving the nation's second-largest city with just one metropolitan newspaper.

title: A.T.&T. Fax Account Goes to Ogilvy & Mather
description: Ogilvy & Mather's New York office yesterday won the advertising account of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's facsimile transmission products - a victory it heralded with an internal memo that said, ''We're Well Again!!''

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: Athlone Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $484,000. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $9,646,000, or $1.85 a share, for the quarter and $8,359,000, or $1.60 a share, for the 9 months.

title: House, 382-37, Approves Bill To Raise the Minimum Wage
description: By a lopsided margin, the House today approved legislation to increase the minimum wage to $4.25 an hour by 1991 and to create a $3.35 training wage for workers under 20 years old.

title: Brooklyn Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Books of The Times; The Caribbean as Lead Character in a Michener Novel
description: Caribbean By James A. Michener 673 pages. Random House. $22.95. Six Days in Havana By James A. Michener and John Kings 144 pages. Illustrated. University of Texas Press. $24.95.

title: Farm & Home Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income The latest quarter and 9-month losses included loss of $9,349,000 from sale of securities and loss of $31,651,000 on sale of loans and mortgage-backed securities. These items were partially offset by a $13,303,000 income-tax credit. The year-ago quarter and 9 months figures included a loss of $8,301,000 from sale of securities, and loss of $31,640,000 from sale of loans and mortgage-backed securities.

title: Sweeps Keep Chimneys Safe for Winter Fires
description: IT is th etime of year to have chimneys inspected. But when you call in the chimney sweep this year, do not be alarmed.

title: Citadel Holding reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax charge of $4.9 million. The charge comprises a write-off of $2.1 million of capitalized costs associated with the proposed acquisition of Valley Federal Savings & Loan Association, which was terminated on Sept. 27, and increases in loan-loss reserves. c-Net income

title: U.N. Calls for 'Early' Afghan Peace Talks
description: At the insistence of the Soviet Union, the United Nations General Assembly unanimously adopted a resolution on Afghanistan today calling for ''an early start'' to new peace talks.

title: Review/Theater; Sid Caesar and a Cast of Many on Broadway
description: When a show-biz legend returns to Broadway after a long absence, especially a legend who has written a memoir of his hard times, he always runs the risk of being upstaged by an audience's memories of his youth. But Sid Caesar, it can happily be reported, looks and sounds the same as ever in his new revue, ''Sid Caesar & Company: Does Anybody Know What I'm Talking About?'' at the Golden. His clown's arsenal is intact, too: the eyeballs and eyelids that can fly and bulge in at least four different directions while mimicking a slot machine, the manic tongue that can fracture any foreign language into ear-bending double talk, the weary skepticism that makes even an elaborately costumed Spanish matador sound like a put-upon waiter at the Carnegie Deli.

title: Martin Broszat, German Historian And War Crimes Expert, 63, Dies
description: Martin Broszat, a prominent West German historian and a specialist on Nazi crimes against the Jews, died on Oct. 14 at his home in Munich after a long illness, his daughter Katrin confirmed yesterday. He was 63 years old.

title: Review/Recital; An Organist With Works New and Not
description: Ellen Taaffe Zwilich was the odd man out, so to speak, at Leonard Raver's remarkable if not always consistently rewarding organ recital Monday night at the Church of the Ascension.

title: Currents; The Clutter Behind Busy Minds
description: THOSE office memos that say, ''From the desk of . . .'' were what inspired Hal Drucker, a New York advertising man, and Sid Lerner, a New York book packager, to write a book on desks.

title: Heads Have a History of Rolling at Newhouse
description: S. I. Newhouse Jr. says he is a ''very predictable man.''

title: Youth Dropped From Jogger Case Is Shot
description: Clarence Thomas, one of the first suspects arrested in the beating and rape of a jogger in Central Park on April 19, was in good condition in Lincoln Hospital last night, recovering from a bullet wound in the left thigh, the police said.

title: Natural Causes Explain Most of Haze Over the Grand Canyon
description: To the Editor:

title: Reliance Move On UAL Stake
description: The UAL Corporation, the parent of United Airlines, said yesterday that it had been notified that Reliance Group Holdings Inc. would seek clearance from the Federal Trade Commission and the Justice Department to buy more than 15 percent of UAL's stock.

title: 2 Administrators Removed to End School's Turmoil
description: Seeking to ''bring quiet'' to a Brooklyn elementary school that has been in turmoil for more than a year, Schools Chancellor Bernard Mecklowitz yesterday approved the transfer of the principal and the assistant principal.

title: Talking Deals; Lenders Taking Care of Business
description: AS more and more companies that have gorged on debt in buyouts or reorganizations suddenly find themselves in need of relief, lenders and Wall Street executives are becoming increasingly involved in running corporate America.

title: No Bail for Jackson Relative
description: Noah Robinson, the Rev. Jesse Jackson's 47-year-old half brother, was denied bail on Monday after the Government had argued he might try to kill or intimidate witnesses against him. Mr. Robinson was indicted last week on charges of skimming profits from restaurants he owns and of hiring gang members to kill a man who uncovered the alleged scheme. At Monday's proceeding, United States Magistrate Elaine Bucklo ordered that he be jailed for trial.

title: CSS Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Studying Vivaldi And Art, In Diapers
description: ROBERTA KATZ remembers feeling frazzled while scheduling her son Simon's fall classes.

title: Budget Problems Deepen for Massachusetts and Its Governor
description: Financial troubles here in Massachusetts have gone from bad to worse in the last three months, and amid the calls for new taxes and more cuts in state spending, there is a flood of anger at Gov. Michael S. Dukakis and his unsuccessful Presidential campaign.

title: Bergeron Is Back at Garden Tonight
description: Michel Bergeron, dismissed last season as coach of the Rangers, said he wasn't sure if, upon his return to Madison Square Garden tonight, he would walk down the hallway and into the locker room of his former players.

title: CNA Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the latest quarter and 9 month results included investment gains of $32,744,000 and $196,039,000, respectively, compared to the year-earlier quarter and 9 months results which included investment gains of $43,922,000 and $205,014,000, respectively.

title: Altering 'Dismal State' of School Libraries
description: Shaun Lee, an 11-year-old sixth grader, has the ''Batman'' movie's bat-shaped emblem shaved into his hair, and his literary tastes run to adventure stories. But until this week Shaun had a problem shared by thousands of other New York City pupils: no good school library in which to find his favorite books.

title: Gleason Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a loss of $1,511,000 from discontinued operations, and after an extraordinary credit of $7,725,000, or $1.35 a share, on the sale of its Gleason Power Systems division. Gleason said the figure is net of operating losses of $667,000 during the phase-out period. c-Net loss and after losses from discontinued operations of $2,828,000 for the quarter and $5,943,000 for the 9 months. Results of Gleason Power Systems have been reclassified and are presented as discontinued operations.

title: PROFITS SCOREBOARD
description: See accompanying notes for special items.(Loss) *Loss in year-earlier period.

title: Deadwood Journal; Gambling Returns To Town Of Legend
description: This celebrated town of the Wild West welcomed its return to legalized gambling today at - when else? - high noon.

title: Pretoria Alerts Its Troops in Namibia in a 'False Alarm'
description: Foreign Minister Roelof F. Botha said today that South Africa had alerted its forces after intercepting communications by United Nations monitors in Namibia saying that up to 600 rebels had infiltrated from Angola in the last week, but United Nations officials dismissed the messages as fraudulent.

title: Control Data, MIPS in Pact
description: MIPS Computer Systems Inc. and the Control Data Corporation said today that they had reached an agreement through which Control would resell computers made by MIPS.

title: Washington Talk; California Has Dream Of Making Presidents
description: California wants to get back into the Presidential nominating game.

title: Alliance Capital Management reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the 1988 9-month figures reflect operations since April 21, 1988 when the partnership began.

title: TRAVEL BAN LIFTED AND EAST GERMANS SWARM TO PRAGUE
description: Hundreds of East Germans swarmed to the West German Embassy here today just hours after East Germany lifted a travel ban, and the official East German press agency said as many as 8,000 had crossed into Czechoslovakia.

title: Quake Estimated at 7.1 Hits Off Japan's Coast
description: A major earthquake registering 7.1 on the Richter scale struck off Honshu Island early today, Japanese officials said. Three coastal villages were ordered evacuated for fear of tidal waves.

title: New East German Chief Hints at Election Changes
description: The East German Communist leader, Egon Krenz, today described the mass protests in his country as a healthy sign of change and hinted that his party would make some concessions to the marchers' demands for more democratic elections.

title: Ocean Drilling & Exploration Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a loss from discontinued contract drilling operations of $50,917,000 and $80,195,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. c-Included a loss from discontinued contract of drilling operations of $11,465,000 and $41,075,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and results for these periods have been restated to reflect the discontinuance of these operations. Latest 9-month results included a benefit of $2,000,000, or 4 cents a share, from reversal of a prior year's provision for a natural gas pricing dispute, and a $1,628,000, or 3 cents a share, charge for restructuring. Year-ago period results included a gain of $4,297,000, or 8 cents a share, from adjustments to certain gas sales contracts.

title: Bridge
description: The world's second-biggest bridge event, after the World Bridge Federation's Epson contest, used to be called the Grand National Pairs. Since it extends outside the borders of the United States, to Canada, Bermuda and Mexico, it is now the North American Open Pairs.

title: Review/Theater; Filling the Stage With a One-Man 'Tempest'
description: In Fred Curchack's ''Stuff as Dreams Are Made On,'' a one-man show becomes a stage-filling phantasmagoria. This freehand reinvention of ''The Tempest,'' in which Mr. Curchack plays all the roles and assumes all directorial and scenic responsibility, opened Tuesday at the Brooklyn Academy of Music as part of the Next Wave festival.

title: Sherwood Group Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: Corrected from Friday, Oct. 20.

title: Only Brooklyn Has a Contest For Prosecutor
description: When voters in New York City go to the polls on Tuesday they will be asked to elect district attorneys in three boroughs. But in two - Manhattan and Queens - the incumbents are running unopposed and in the other, Brooklyn, where two candidates are on the ballot, the outcome is generally regarded as a foregone conclusion.

title: Goldman Sells $700 Million In 2 New Fannie Mae Funds
description: The Federal National Mortgage Association, known as Fannie Mae, and Goldman, Sachs & Campany announced yesterday that they have sold to overseas investors, mainly Japanese, about $700 million in two new international Goldman, Sachs funds that invest mostly in mortgage securities issued by Fannie Mae.

title: Mary Beth Hurt's Juggling Act
description: Acting in the theater, says Mary Beth Hurt, is hard. Acting in the theater when you have two small children, she says, is even harder.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: * Black & Decker Corp., Towson, Md., a maker of power tools and household and outdoor products, said it would sell four unspecified companies by the end of this year.

title: Driver-Harris Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included extraordinary credits of $29,000, or 2 cents a share, for the quarter and $123,000, or 9 cents a share, for the 9 months. c-Included extraordinary credits of $14,000, or 1 cent a share, and $213,000, or 17 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: Edward Connolly, 74, Brooklyn Lawyer, Dies
description: Edward J. Connolly, a lawyer in Brooklyn for almost half a century, died of cancer yesterday at his home in Brightwater, L.I. He was 74 years old.

title: Greyhound Canada reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a special gain of $786,000, or 9 cents a share, from the sale of property. Results are in Canadian funds.

title: Help, at Last, for the Working Poor
description: When President Bush vetoed a $4.55 an hour minimum wage bill in the spring he invited a legislative compromise: a smaller minimum wage increase combined with an expansion of tax credits for the working poor. Fortunately, that compromise is about to become reality.

title: Metro Bancshares reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $719,000 charge for staff reduction and early retirement program. The per share earnings and shares outstanding were not meaningful for periods prior to Nov. 10, 1988 stock conversion for year-ago quarter, latest year and prior year.

title: Home Unity Savings reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After income of $377,000, or 18 cents a share, from discontinued operations. The company said its latest quarter figures included a gain of about $464,000 from the sale of 53 units from a property in its real estate portfolio. The latest quarter reflected a savings of about $1.6 million from the year-ago quarter on most general and administrative expenses.

title: Savings Bond Sales Suspended by U.S.
description: Sales of United States Savings Bonds were indefinitely suspended today because Congress failed to enact legislation raising the Federal debt limit. Without the legislation, the Government's borrowing authority dropped from $2.87 trillion to $2.80 trillion at midnight Tuesday.

title: New Continental Head Will Not Shift Strategy
description: Mickey P. Foret, the new president of Continental Airlines, has no plans to make any big changes at the airline, which has begun to show signs of turning around.

title: Abortion Is Major Issue In L.I. Prosecutor's Race
description: The national debate over abortion rights has overtaken a local race on Long Island, where the Nassau County District Attorney's public efforts to overturn legalized abortion have brought him his first challenger in eight years.

title: Director To Resign At National Academy
description: John H. Dobkin, the director of the National Academy of Art and Design in New York since 1988 and the originator during that time of many important changes in the academy's activity, is to relinquish his post at a date not yet announced.

title: Coleco Pursues Reorganization
description: Coleco Industries Inc., the former high-flying toy company, filed a reorganization plan with support from its creditors. Under the plan, a reorganized Coleco would be called Ranger Industries, and James Rubin, the head of the unsecured creditors group, would be its chief executive. The plan calls for Coleco's unsecured creditors to receive stock in Ranger.

title: INSIDE
description: New Move on Capital Gains

title: Stewart New Subject of Promoter's Old Strategy
description: One night not so long ago, at the Felt Forum, Mike Jones, the fight manager, was kidding a reporter about an alternative career.

title: Move to Kill Victim Described By Defendant in Jogger Rape
description: A defendant in the Central Park jogger rape case wanted to kill the victim so she could not identify her attackers, another defendant said in a videotape played in court yesterday.

title: First Federal Savings (Ala.) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Terrorism: Five Strange Facts
description: The purpose of this column is to present five strange and so far undiscussed facts about American policy toward terrorism, and to raise the disturbing questions that flow from them.

title: Yugoslav Freighter Is Pulled From Reef in Florida Straits
description: A Yugoslav cargo ship that ran aground in the Florida Straits with a load of 14,300 tons of phosphate was pulled free of a coral reef tonight, the Coast Guard said.

title: KEY RATES
Fulton Federal Savings reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Freeport-McMoran Gets Financing
description: The Freeport-McMoran Copper Company, the New Orleans affiliate of Freeport-McMoran Inc., announced yesterday that it had obtained $550 million in financing from a syndicate of commercial banks for the expansion and debt refinancing of Freeport Indonesia Inc., a copper mining and milling operation.

title: Tanzania Must Not Fence In the Proud, Cattle-Herding Masai; People Come First
description: To the Editor:

title: Robert Half International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Latest 9-month figures included a pretax gain of $440,000 from repurchase of debentures.

title: Miss Lieberbaum, Teacher, Is Wed
description: Susan Michele Lieberbaum, the daughter of Carol A. Lieberbaum of New York and Sheldon J. Lieberbaum of North Miami Beach, Fla., was married yesterday to Stephen Lewis Rabinowitz, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Rabinowitz of Brooklyn. Rabbi Jacob Greenberg officiated at the Kingsway Jewish Center in Brooklyn.

title: Judges in Medellin Strike After 2 Slayings
description: All 42 of the federal judges in Medellin went on strike indefinitely today after the slaying of a federal judge and a congressman, apparently by drug traffickers.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Job for Hill, Holliday
description: Fresh from the success of its television ads for Infiniti, Nissan's new luxury sedan, Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos/New York yesterday won the advertising account of Sportschannel America. The business comprises the cable sports network's trade and consumer accounts, with a budget of about $2 million.

title: Pic 'n' Save reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
As Thousands in Campaign Donations Pour In, Small Dinkins Staff Is Overwhelmed
description: So many contributions are pouring into David N. Dinkins's campaign that a small staff cannot immediately count them and log them into the required financial records.

title: Bennet Korn, 75, TV Executive
description: Bennet H. Korn, an executive with the Metromedia Corporation in the 1950's and 60's, died of a heart attack at his home in Walnut Creek, Calif., on Tuesday. He was 75 years old and suffered from amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, also known as Lou Gehrig's disease.

title: Reviews/Film; Midwestern Angst, Farce and Horror, by Students
description: In ''King's Road,'' the most memorable of the student films being shown together at the Angelika Film Center as ''New York Shorts: Five New Films From N.Y.U.,'' Joseph Rosato has created a moody vignette of Midwestern angst that centers on the ambivalent relationship of two brothers.

title: Cabot Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After income from discontinued operations of $24,566,000 for both the quarter and year. c-Net income d-After an extraordinary charge of $816,000. The latest quarter's income from continuing operations included after- tax charges of $63.8 million related to restructuring and reorganization costs.

title: Corrections
description: A map on Oct. 27 showing states enrolled in regional plans to dispose of hazardous waste misidentified the group to which New Mexico belongs.

title: Auctions
description: Major contemporary artworks - a double flag by Jasper Johns, a comic strip image by Roy Lichtenstein, a near-abstract painting of a woman by Willem de Kooning and 12 Andy Warhol paintings, two of which are ''Liz'' images - are to be auctioned next week at Christie's and Sotheby's.

title: More East Germans Seek Passage Through Prague
description: The number of East Germans seeking refuge in the West German Embassy compound here to obtain passage to the West swelled today to more than 1,300, and more continued to stream in.

title: On Stage
description: Of Tommy Tune

title: Sffed Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax charge of $17 million from the sale of about $965 million of assets and the repayment of short-term non-deposit liabilities. c-Net income and the 9 months included a gain of $6.5 million, or 84 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting, and a loss of $5,360,000 from a restatement of an accounting adjustment.

title: UNR Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $320,000, or 1 cent a share, for the quarter; the 9 months included a loss from discontinued operations of $2,355,235 and a loss of $109,619,174 from extraordinary charges related to reorganization expenses. c-Included losses from discontinued operations of $31,507 and $15,416 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively; the 9 months also included a tax credit of $1,100,000, or 2 cents a share. d-Net income
