description: Love and Tragedy

title: Pretoria Playing Down Namibia 'Infiltration'
description: The South African Government moved today to play down Foreign Minister Roelof F. Botha's contention on Wednesday that hundreds of black nationalist guerrillas were infiltrating into Namibia in advance of elections next week.

title: For Gatherers of U.S. Data, A Close Call Last Month
description: This is the story of a near miss in the troubled world of data gathering.

title: LAWMAKERS AGREE ON 'STAR WARS' CUT
description: Congressional negotiators announced today that they had agreed on a $305 billion military programs bill that for the first time forces cuts in spending on the Pentagon's ''Star Wars'' program.

title: Review/Music; Chorale in Mozart and Bach
description: The concert by Martin Josman and his National Chorale on Wednesday evening at Avery Fisher Hall reflected a certain amount of musicological homework.

title: Penguin Names U.S. Chief
description: The Penguin Group Inc. said yesterday that it had chosen Morton Mint to become chief executive officer of Penguin USA. Mr. Mint is currently the president and publisher of Penguin Canada.

title: Shared Medical Systems Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Risk Seen in Market Plan
description: Sunshine and slower markets were proposed yesterday as the temporary cure for sharp downward moves in the stock market. But while the changes may slow trading, they could also create confusion about market prices, perhaps helping to further alarm customers who are unable to sell when prices are falling.

title: Fastest Marathoner Eyes Quicker Time
description: His first name means ''on top,'' his surname means ''Lion.'' He has dark piercing eyes, an angular jaw, an easy smile and an attitude that dances somewhere between confident and cocky.

title: Newmont Mining Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After loss on disposal from discontinued operations of $3,649,000. c-Net loss and included loss from discontinued operations of $203,000, and a loss of $43,897,000 on disposal from discontinued operations. d-Included income of $11,526,000, or 17 cents a share, from discontinued operations and a loss on disposal of discontinued operations of $739,000. The year-ago periods were previously restated for the $43.9 million net loss on investment in Magma Copper Co. and included pre-tax charges of $28 million for relocation of the company's headquarters.

title: First National Bank Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Japan Realtor in Texas Deal
description: A Japanese group led by the real estate developer Taikichiro Mori, said it would purchase for $300 million an 85 percent stake in a four-skyscraper complex in the center of Houston together with American investors.

title: National Patent Development Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included gains of $111,000 for the quarter and $1,352,000 for the 9 months from early extinguishment of debt. c-Net income and included gains of $673,000 and $3,133,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, from the early extinguishment of debt.

title: U.S. Indictment Links Mafia and Medellin Group
description: Twelve people have been indicted in a case that provides the first hard evidence of a cocaine smuggling link between the Sicilian Mafia and the Medellin drug ring of Colombia, Federal agents said today.

title: SALVADOR REBELS QUIT PEACE TALKS
description: Leftist rebels pulled out of negotiations with the rightist Government today and accused it of the bombing of a labor federation headquarters in which at least nine people were killed.

title: Inter-City Gas reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss of $1.6 million for the quarter and income of $1.2 million, or 6 cents a share, for the 9 months, from discontinued operations. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $2.6 million for the quarter and $4 million for the 9 months.

title: Violations at Florida Bring Call for Statewide Monitoring
description: Athletics at the University of Florida have been under investigation by one agency or another for the last 18 months, from a Federal grand jury to the Drug Enforcement Administration to the National Collegiate Athletic Association. But October 1989 will be remembered as the darkest 31 days in Gator history.

title: Blighted Buildings Renovated in Bedford-Stuyvesant
description: LEAD: Boarded buildings and rubble-strewn lots are widespread in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn, but neighborhoods that appear mired in deterioration to some are offering redevelopment opportunities to others.

title: BEIRUT PARLIAMENT SUMMONED TO MEET
description: The Speaker of Parliament summoned legislators today to meet on Saturday to ratify a peace agreement and elect a new Lebanese president, but the Christian army commander, Gen. Michel Aoun, later threatened to take ''decisive measures'' to block the session.

title: Soviet Miners' Strike Spreads, Testing Walkout Ban
description: An illegal wildcat strike has spread to most of the coal mines in the Arctic city of Vorkuta, confronting Soviet authorities with their most serious test of a new law restricting labor walkouts.

title: Fibreboard Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss of $47,000 for the quarter and income of $2,467,000, or 64 cents a share for the 9 months, both from discontinued operations. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $423,000, or 11 cents a share, and $17,520,000, or $4.52 a share for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. The company said the results of the quarter included several unusual items from implementing the previously announced restructuring program. Wood products operations were further consolidated in California with the sale of the round Prairie, Ore. Stud Mill resulting in a pre-tax gain of approximately $2 million. The sale of approximately 73 acres of surplus real estate in Rocklin, Calif., provided an additional before tax gain of approximately $4.2 million. The after- tax impact of these transactions was $3.5 million, or 91 cents a share. Year-ago figures included a gain from the sale of the container products division in March 1988.

title: Puget Sound Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income The company said third-quarter results were significantly impacted by a $14.6 million after-tax special provision for possible loan and real estate losses.

title: Review/Theater; Romping Through Zurich In Stoppard's 'Travesties'
description: History has long made footnote of the fact that James Joyce, Lenin and Tristan Tzara were all neighbors in Zurich just as the Great War was reaching its apex and the Russian Revolution was getting under way. But it is thanks to Tom Stoppard that those titans of literature, politics and art have come to be inexorably linked with a fourth resident of Zurich at that time - one Henry Carr, a junior British consular official and amateur thespian.

title: Pennsylvania REIT reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Included gains of $172,293 and $250,328 on sales of real estate interests for the quarter and year, respectively.

title: 2 Companies Win Awards
description: The Xerox Corporation's manufacturing operations and the privately owned textile maker Milliken & Company were named yesterday as the 1989 winners of the Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Awards by the Commerce Department.

title: Review/Art; Out of the Past, the Spirit of Italian Futurism
description: ''We want to glorify war - the world's only hygiene,'' proclaimed the Futurist manifesto that was published on the front page of the French newspaper Le Figaro in 1909. And when war came to Europe five years later, it cleansed the world of two of Futurism's most outspoken proponents, Umberto Boccioni and Antonio Sant'Elia.

title: Reviews/Film; The Obsession of an Actor Playing a Hungarian Poet
description: ''Forced March,'' opening today at Cinema 1, is about a successful American television actor who goes to Hungary to play the leading role in a film about the Hungarian poet Miklos Radnoti, a Jew, who died in the Holocaust.

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: Poughkeepsie Savings reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income The bank said the third quarter loss was largely the result of two previously announced non-recurring charges: $8.3 million for the writeoff of goodwill related to its investment in branches in North Carolina and South Carolina; and $1.5 million for adjustment of interest income on certain mortgage-backed securities related to prior periods. The year-ago 9 months included pre- tax gains of $6.8 million on a sale of mortgage-backed securities interests and a one-time benefit of $3.4 million from a pension plan reversion.

title: Funds Barred For Advisers On Abortion
description: A Federal appeals court has set back efforts by family-planning groups in New York State to continue providing abortion information to clients without losing Federal funds.

title: 3 Are Indicted Over Money Transfers
description: The Attorney General of New York said yesterday that three men had been indicted for running a company that had illegally transmitted about $70 million to the Dominican Republic and elsewhere in Latin America in more than 500,000 transactions.

title: Campaign Spending in New Jersey Criticized
description: New Jersey's most expensive State Assembly campaign was called ''a fund-raising arms race'' today by a state election official, who said controls on spending should be imposed in the future.

title: Bishops Emphasize Ethics in Ban on Condoms; Law of Secondary Effect
description: To the Editor:

title: Orion Capital Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax provision of $2,480,000 for Hurricane Hugo claims for the quarter; the 9 months included a loss of $491,000 which reflected the cumulative effect of adoption of SFAS No. 96. c-Included an investment loss of $810,000 and an investment gain of $881,000 for the latest and year-ago 9 months, respectively. The periods for 1988 reflected the inclusion, from Jan. 1, 1988, of Guaranty National Corp. on a fully consolidated basis, net of a provision for the portion of Guaranty National Corp.'s earnings which are attributable to shareholders other than the company.

title: Review/Film; Chaplinesque Artist and Waif Among the Homeless
description: For someone who's made a 97-minute, black-and-white silent film in this day and age and appeared as the innocent, childlike fellow at its center, the word Chaplinesque is inevitable. For Charles Lane, whose ''Sidewalk Stories'' opens today, it's even apt. Mr. Lane, a slight, spry figure with a demeanor that can switch instantly from playful to plaintive, very pointedly recalls the sweet pathos of Chaplin's lonely little tramp.

title: Data General Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included restructuring charge of $80 million for corporate consolidation. c-Included restructuring charge of $48.7 million and a gain of $5.9 million from sale of facility.

title: Economic Scene; The Rift in Britain On Joining Europe
description: THE political crisis sweeping Britain, the most serious to hit Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher since she took office more than 10 years ago, has a fundamental economic issue at its roots: Should Britain become a full member of the European Monetary System as soon as possible or would it be dangerous for it to link the pound to the European currencies, especially the West German mark, at a time when the British inflation rate is high and the nation could be on the verge of recession as well? And underlying that issue is the deep, historic question: How much sovereignty should Britain be willing to sacrifice to join Europe?

title: Savings Bond Rates Fall
description: United States Savings Bonds will earn 6.98 percent interest in the next six months, down from the 7.81 percent rate of the last six months, the Treasury Department said Wednesday. New sales have been suspended because Congress has not enacted legislation raising the Federal debt limit. When sales resume, bonds issued in November will earn interest from the first of the month.

title: Masco Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary credit of $6,690,000, or 8 cents a share, from a gain on early extinguishment of debt through the repurchase of convertible securities for both periods.

title: Campaign Profile; Warily, Giuliani Learns To Embrace the Voters
description: A white-haired woman put on a scratchy recording of ''New York, New York'' at a Brooklyn community center the other day and claimed the first dance with Rudolph W. Giuliani, gently nudging another woman aside.

title: Senate Shelves Effort to Disclose Mail Costs
description: Members of the Senate made clear today that they want the House of Representatives to join them in disclosing the cost of Congressional mass mailings, but, to avoid scuttling an agreement to reduce the taxpayer-financed mailings by half, they declined to force the issue.

title: Loews Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included realized investment gains of $18.9 million, or 25 cents a share, for the quarter and $108.4 million, or $1.44 a share, for the 9 months. c-Included realized investment gains of $24.3 million, or 32 cents a share, for the quarter and $123.1 million, or $1.62 a share, for the 9 months; the quarter also included a gain on sale of an oil tanker by a shipping subsidiary of $6.8 million, or 9 cents a share, and the 9 months included income of $18,067,000, or 24 cents a share, from discontinued operations, reflecting gain on disposition of the CBS Records division. The net for the year-ago 9 months also included a gain on the sale by Lorillard of its chewing and little cigar business, amounting to $29.4 million, or 39 cents a share, and the third quarter gain of $6.8 million.

title: Presidential Life reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Scotty's Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and after a tax credit of $2,695,000 and a pretax restructuring reserve of $7,285,000. The company said this year's first quarter results included an increased LIFO charge of $100,000 over the comparable period of fiscal 1989, as well as increased real estate gains of $350,000 from the sale of a closed store property.

title: Girl Is Wounded by Stray Bullet in Brooklyn
description: A 15-year-old girl was shot in the neck outside her high school in Brooklyn yesterday, apparently by a stray bullet fired from a block away during a dispute between two groups of youths who fled, the police said.

title: Videotron Ltee reports earnings for Year to Aug 31
description: b-Included extraordinary losses of $2,128,000 and $2,899,000 for the latest year and prior years, respectively. Figures are in Canadian funds.

title: Our Towns; Bar-less Town Looks to Build On Shot and Beer
description: Laura DePasquale moved here five years ago from Jersey City because she liked the character of the town. ''Part of that is there are no taverns,'' Mrs. DePasquale said. ''In Jersey City, I lived down the street from a bar, and I wanted to get away from that. I selected this town for several reasons, and no bars is one of them.''

title: Review/Film; 'Seduction: The Cruel Woman,' a Study in Power
description: Wanda, the heroine of ''Seduction: The Cruel Woman,'' goes around smashing sexual stereotypes and social taboos with icy self-possession and a mysteriously satisfied smile. She has flowing dark hair, the glamorous, brightly made-up face of a Barbie doll, and a Tallulah Bankhead voice with which she growls orders at her several female lovers. A businesswoman as well as a dominatrix, Wanda purrs at a male journalist who has come to interview her about the opening of her new ''gallery,'' where flesh is whipped in public performances and where private, slavish fantasies are fulfilled. ''It is my profession, being cruel,'' Wanda tells the reporter. ''Your profession is writing. That is not exactly harmless, is it?''

title: Sugar Concerns Planning to Merge
description: Suedzucker A.G. of West Germany agreed to pay nearly $740 million for a Belgian sugar maker in a deal that puts it in contention to become Europe's biggest sugar producer. Suedzucker will pay $737.7 million to buy about 75 percent of Raffinerie Tirlemontoise of Belgium from RT Holding Nederland, a Dutch food group. The Mannheim-based group said it would make a public offer for the remaining shares as soon as possible.

title: Athens Journal; Woman in Mourning Proudly Picks Up a Banner
description: When terrorists killed her husband on his way to Parliament in September, Dora Bakoyannis decided that bullets would not bring an end to his cause.

title: NUI to Buy Utility In Pennsylvania
description: The NUI Corporation agreed to acquire Pennsylvania Enterprises Inc. for $51.50 a share. The payment will be 30 percent in cash and the rest in NUI shares valued at the average price over 20 trading days before Pennsylvania Enterprise, a water and gas utility in Wilkes-Barre, Pa., is merged into NUI. Pennsylvania Enterprises' stockholders will not receive more than three NUI shares or fewer than 2.6 NUI shares for each share of Pennsylvania Enterprises.

title: Japan Buys the Center of New York
description: Japan's Sony Corporation bought Columbia Pictures last month. Now Mitsubishi is paying $846 million for 51 percent of the Rockefeller Group, owner of Rockefeller Center, the vibrant Art Deco cluster of 19 buildings in the heart of New York City. Is the transfer of American assets to Japanese ownership something to worry about?

title: Mr. Ortega's War
description: Whatever Daniel Ortega's intention, the Nicaraguan President's renunciation of a cease-fire with contra rebels has confounded hopes for free elections and an end to his nation's interminable war. He has left room for retreat, and could yet reverse himself. For now, the Sandinista leader needs to reckon the costs of throwing a grenade into a promising, arduously wrought regional peace plan.

title: Business Digest
description: The Economy

title: Dow Declines by 14.34; Computer Stocks Weak
description: Stocks ended moderately lower yesterday, pushed down by broad weakness in computer stocks.

title: The Problems of the A.B.A. President's Firm Mirror Ills in the Profession
description: If anyone symbolizes the stability of the nation's lawyers, it is supposed to be the president of the American Bar Association. But as the troubles facing the current office holder, L. Stanley Chauvin Jr. of Louisville, attest, he can also represent the turbulence.

title: Connecticut Drops Charges In Gay-Rights Clash at Yale
description: Connecticut today dropped misdemeanor charges against five people arrested at Yale University in a clash between the police and those attending a gay-studies conference.

title: Prison Head in Pennsylvania Is Suspended After Violence
description: The superintendent of the state prison here where more than 100 people were hurt in two nights of riots was suspended Wednesday after guards charged that officials did nothing about broken cell locks after the first night of turmoil.

title: Watsonville Journal; A Lost City Of Tents Is Legacy Of Quake
description: For days, city and Red Cross officials came to the tents that sprang up at Callaghan Park here shortly after the earthquake to try to persuade occupants to move to a shelter.

title: Cup Track Is First-Time Starter
description: Handicappers who have been excavating piles of old race-result charts, trying to see which of the entrants in the Breeders' Cup races Saturday have run well at Gulfstream Park before, have probably been mining fool's gold. Gulfstream has been around since 1940, but Saturday's track surface is brand-new.

title: 4 Ethnic Albanians Die In a Yugoslav Protest
description: At least four ethnic Albanian demonstrators were killed today in Kosovo province as protests continued over the trial of a former Communist Party leader, Belgrade television reported.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: INTERNATIONAL A3-11 A Brazilian television star has entered the Presidential election, only two weeks away, and a poll shows that he could win. Page A1

title: Commercial Federal Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax gain of $11.7 million on the sale of the company's credit card portfolio.

title: For County Executive, County D.A.
description: County Executive, Nassau County. Republican incumbent Thomas Gulotta has demonstrated thoughtfulness and political skill. He is knowledgeable about environmental issues, and although he's fallen prey to tax-cut fever, has a firm grasp of budget issues.

title: St. John's Player Hurt
description: Jayson Williams, the senior forward who led St. John's in scoring last season, fractured his right foot and will not be able to play for four to six weeks. St. John's opens its season Nov. 16 against North Carolina A. & T. in the early-season National Invitation Tournament.

title: David Blumberg, 78; Headed B'nai B'rith
description: David M. Blumberg, a retired insurance agent who was a former president of B'nai B'rith International, died Wednesday after open heart surgery at the Washington Hospital Center. He was 78 years old and lived in Washington.

title: Bengals Hope Offense Is Rolling Once Again
description: The Cincinnati Bengals had been scratching their heads and mulling over what plug had been pulled on their razzmatazz offense. Cincinnati had lost 2 straight games at home, where they had won 12 straight. In those losses the Bengals scored only 13 points against the vulnerable Miami Dolphins and only 12 against the Indianapolis Colts.

title: Morris DeGroot, 58, A Statistics Professor
description: Morris H. DeGroot, professor of statistics and industrial administration at Carnegie Mellon University, died of lung cancer yesterday at his home in Pittsburgh. He was 58 years old.

title: Peruvian Army Patrols Lima To Ward Off Guerrilla Attack
description: Soldiers took control of highways leading into the capital and armored units patrolled the city today, the day after an attack by leftist guerrillas on police forces guarding a religious procession.

title: Peoples Bancorp of Worceser reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Hogwood in Beethoven
description: Christopher Hogwood will conduct the Academy of Ancient Music in an all-Beethoven program at Avery Fisher Hall on Sunday at 3 P.M. The program includes the ''Creatures of Prometheus'' Overture, the Fifth Symphony and the Violin Concerto. Monica Huggett is to be the soloist in the concerto. Tickets are $13 to $25. Information: 874-6770.

title: Votrax Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Senate Panel Rejects Labor Dept. Nominee
description: The Senate Labor and Human Resources Committee on Wednesday rejected the nomination of Debra R. Bowland to head the Labor Department's wage and hour division, citing her work to overturn a Louisiana wage law covering government contracts.

title: Tribute to Milton Goldman
description: A memorial service for the theatrical agent Milton Goldman is to be held at noon on Monday at the Shubert Theater, 225 West 44th Street. Among those expected to participate are the actors Douglas Fairbanks Jr., Helen Hayes, Jack Gilford, Irene Worth, Garson Kanin, Vanessa Redgrave and Geraldine Futzgerald.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Addenda
description: * The One Club will display the advertising of Wieden & Kennedy, a Portland, Ore.-based agency known for its advertising for Nike, at its Manhattan gallery through Dec. 8.

title: An Australian Family Applauds New York
description: To the Editor:

title: Review/Film; Grim Voices From Brazil
description: The Public Theater's documentary series Brazil Why, focusing on that country's social conditions, begins today with Octavio Bezerra's horrifying, sincere and very slippery vision of life among the underclass. ''An Avenue Called Brazil'' might have been even more forceful if it had been a true documentary instead of an unlabeled mix of real-life scenes and re-enactments.

title: Showscan Film reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Leveraged Buyout Leader Shifts Attention
description: In another indication that future corporate takeovers may not heavily rely on debt, one of the largest leveraged buyout firms is trying to raise $3 billion from institutions to invest in publicly traded companies without borrowing.

title: Hondurans Reject Nicaragua Call for Talks on Rebels
description: Asserting that existing peace accords are sufficient, the Honduran Government has bluntly rejected a Nicaraguan call for urgent new talks on demobilizing the rebel army.

title: Review/Circus; Big Apple's New Faces: Grandma And a Bison
description: After last season's collaboration with the Nanjing Acrobatic Troupe, the Big Apple Circus has done an about-face. Its new show, ''Grandma Goes West,'' is a rambunctious but not-so-wild version of a cowboy jamboree. As usual, the entertainment (in a heated tent at Lincoln Center) is intimate and unpretentious. Children in the front rows reach out as if to touch the animals.

title: Reynolds & Reynolds Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an accounting adjustment loss of $507,000 for the quarter and an accounting adjustment gain of $8,015,000, or 75 cents a share, for the year. These accounting adjustments reflected revaluing of deferred income taxes. Sales figures for 1988 have been restated to reflect accounting changes. Results for the year-ago quarter and year's income before items included $6,167,000, or 57 cents a share, and $11,413,000, or $1.06 a share, respectively, from operations.

title: Totes to Acquire German Company
description: Totes Inc., which makes and sells umbrellas, boots and other footwear, agreed to buy a West German company that distributes umbrellas. Bradford E. Phillips, Totes's chief executive, signed the agreement in West Germany to buy Jagra-Haus G.m.b.H. The German company will be renamed Totes Deutschland. Mr. Phillips did not disclose the purchase price but said it was a cash deal.

title: Soviets Faulted on Regional Conflicts
description: A senior Defense Department official complained today that the Soviet Union was continuing to fuel regional conflicts, offering a more pointed critique of Soviet conduct than Secretary of State James A. Baker 3d has in recent speeches.

title: INSIDE
description: U.S. and Central America While denouncing Nicaragua for ending a truce, the United States has resisted provisions of a regional peace accords. News analysis, page A8. Council Race in Yonkers The Yonkers City Council race is seen as a referendum on the disputed housing desegregation plan that has dominated local politics. Page B1. More Troubles for Pierce Nineteen House Democrats asked the Attorney General to name an independent prosecutor to investigate the former Housing Secretary. Page A12. Ford to Buy Jaguar The auto maker beat out General Motors in a battle to acquire a big chunk of British prestige. Page D1. Dark Days at U. of Florida Violations at the university have the Governor calling for statewide monitoring of athletics. Page A27.

title: TV Weekend; Eternal Verities in Wilder's 'Our Town'
description: The genius of Thornton Wilder's ''Our Town'' is in its simplicity. Writing in 1938 about the way people are, ''in our living and our dying,'' the scholarly Wilder devised a play drawing on what philosophers call the eternal verities. The townsfolk of his Grover's Corners in New Hampshire live within thoroughly familiar, unchanging cycles. The first act, introducing the Gibbs and Webb families, begins at dawn and ends at bedtime. The second revolves around courtship and marriage. The third ponders death and the painful realization that life goes so fast ''we don't have time to look at one another.''

title: Gibson Greetings reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included reversal of tax penalty of $3.1 million previously recorded in 1987 and 1988, and associated interest expense. These factors contributed 26 cents a share to net income.

title: Rental Rate Increase Set By A.T.& T.
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company said yesterday that it would raise its rental rates for residential telephone equipment by an average of 12 percent in the first quarter of next year.

title: Ford to Buy Jaguar for $2.38 Billion
description: In a deal that reflects the continuing consolidation of the world auto industry and the eagerness of big car makers to acquire prestigious brands, the Ford Motor Company announced today that it plans to buy Jaguar P.L.C. for a total of nearly $2.38 billion.

title: Books of The Times; Reconciling Old and New in Late-Colonial Nigeria
description: Isara A Voyage Around ''Essay.'' By Wole Soyinka 262 pages. Random House. $18.95.

title: Pop/Jazz; 9 Days and Nights of the Blues
description: THE blues is a hot property again.

title: Domtar Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $1,000,000, or 1 cent a share for the quarter and $9,000,000, or 10 cents a share for the 9 months. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $1,000,000, or 1 cent a share and $5,000,000, or 6 cents a share for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. The company said income from discontinued operations represents earnings from the company's chemicals and energy business, which is in the process of being divested. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Alexander & Alexander Servces Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $1,100,000, or 3 cents a share for both the quarter and 9 months. c-Included an extraordinary credit of $2,500,000, or 6 cents a share for the quarter and 9 months.

title: Sidney Krakauer, 69, Inventor and Executive
description: Sidney Krakauer, an inventor of biomedical systems and a retired corporate executive, died Monday at Boca Raton (Fla.) Hospital after a brief illness. He was 69 years old and lived in Highland Beach, Fla.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * American Express Travel Related Services Co., a unit of American Express, promoted B. Robert Greenfield and Ellen R. Williams to senior vice presidents.

title: Cheshire Financial Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
From Restivo, a New Look of Softness
description: Mary Ann Restivo changed course for spring, easing up on the tailoring she is known for and going for softer, more feminine clothes. As a result, the collection she showed in New York this week was one of her strongest.

title: PLM International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings for 1989 periods have been reduced by $802,000 in preferred stock dividends.

title: Exercise and Longevity: A Little Goes a Long Way
description: The largest study measuring fitness ever carried out suggests that even modest amounts of exercise can substantially reduce a person's chance of dying of heart disease, cancer or other causes.

title: Review/Film; Private Detectives and Public Peculiarities
description: The dark cloud that is ''Second Sight'' has a silver lining, at least for the economy-minded. Both John Larroquette (star of television's ''Night Court'') and Bronson Pinchot (''Perfect Strangers'') are much, much funnier for free.

title: MCN Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Profits Scoreboard
Cowles Sale Of 2 Papers
description: The Cowles Media Company said today that it would sell The Rapid City Journal in South Dakota and The Great Falls Tribune in Montana and would offer to buy back up to 250,000 shares.

title: Senate Panel Clears Bill On Futures
description: The Sen-ate Agriculture Committee today approved legislation intended to increase Federal oversight of the nation's futures markets and to strengthen self-regulation at the commodity exchanges.

title: American International Group reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the latest quarter and 9 months results included realized pretax capital gains of $27,907,000 and $96,129,000, respectively, and the year-earlier quarter results included a realized pretax capital loss of $19,233,000 and the 9 months included a realized pretax capital gains of $54,873,000. Year-ago results are restated for an accounting change. The company also said included in the 1989 operating results was the ''fresh start'' tax benefit, which reduced the provision for income taxes by about $13 million in the third quarter and $46 million for the first 9 months of 1989. In 1988, the comparable ''fresh start'' figures were $25 million and $80 million, respectively.

title: First American Bank & Trust reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article by The Associated Press in some editions on Saturday about a farm where marijuana was found growing last year misstated an admission made by Robert Machin as part of a settlement to keep the farm. He admitted he had grown the plants; he did not admit having done so to pay property taxes.

title: Exchange Curbs Computer Trades To Reduce Stock Price Volatility
description: Seeking to reduce wild price swings that have unsettled the financial markets in recent weeks, the New York Stock Exchange yesterday announced strict limits on the computerized trading of stocks.

title: Hanover Insurance Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Review/Art; An Art of Motion: Joan Mitchell's Abstract Expressionism
description: The nine paintings in Joan Mitchell's first show at the Robert Miller Gallery are lucid and fresh. They are also ambitious and unapologetic, the kinds of works that people may like or dislike but that nobody who loves or hates painting can dismiss.

title: Strategies for Dining Cheaply and Well
description: NEW YORK is one of the most expensive dining cities in the world; it is also one of the cheapest. You can have a transcendent feast for $100 at the Quilted Giraffe, or a platter of lemon-grass chicken at Saigon in Chinatown for $5.95. Finding the best dining bargains in town requires persistence and a resilient stomach, as I learned on a recent tour of about three dozen inexpensive restaurants in Manhattan.

title: Amity Bancorp Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Films and Discussions On Psychoanalysis
description: A screening of ''Secrets of a Soul,'' a 1926 silent feature about a knife phobia, will begin a film and discussion series devoted to the depiction of psychoanalysis in film at the Anthology Film Archives, 32-34 Second Avenue, at Second Street.

title: Union Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $519,000, or 7 cents a share, and income from discontinued operations of $274,000, or 4 cents a share.

title: Inmate Escapes From Hospital; Rapes Woman
description: A Rikers Island prisoner being held on robbery charges escaped from a Brooklyn hospital yesterday and three hours later forced a woman into her apartment and raped her, the police said.

title: Household International Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After income from discontinued operations of $6.2 million, or 18 cents a share, for the quarter and $21.1 million, or 60 cents a share, for the 9 months. c-After income from discontinued operations of $14.8 million, or 43 cents a share, for the quarter and $46.5 million, or $1.34 a share, for the 9 months.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Accounts
description: * CoreStates Financial Corp., to Earle Palmer Brown & Spiro, Philadelphia, with a budget of $5 million.

title: Top Field for a 20th Celebration
description: The men's field is one of the best ever assembled for a race in the United States. The women will probably generate more drama for second place.

title: Total Energold reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Figures are in Canadian funds.

title: Choral Society
description: Kenneth Dake will conduct the St. George's Choral Society and Orchestra in a program of Bach Cantatas at St. George's Church on Stuyvesant Square, 16th Street east of Third Avenue, at 4 P.M. on Sunday. The program includes the cantatas ''Gottes Zeit Ist die Allerbeste Zeit'' (No. 106); ''Lobe den Herren'' (No. 137) and ''O Jesu Christ Mein Lebens Licht'' (No. 118). The concert is to be preceded by a recital of Bach organ works, played by Mr. Dake, at 3:40 P.M. Admission is free. Information: 475-0830.

title: A Japanese Strategy for Boeing
description: The Boeing Company, once fiercely independent and self-reliant, is turning to partnerships with the Japanese in the belief that there is no better way to preserve its position as the world's leading aircraft manufacturer. But the emerging alliance is not without a conflict: while the Japanese try to learn everything they can about making airplanes, Boeing tries to hide its most important techniques.

title: Sadie T. M. Alexander, 91, Dies; Lawyer and Civil Rights Advocate
description: Sadie Tanner Mosell Alexander, a lawyer and civil rights advocate for 50 years who achieved a number of academic and professional distinctions as a black woman, died of pneumonia Wednesday at Cathedral Village, a retirement community, in Philadelphia. She was 91 years old and had been hospitalized with Alzheimer's disease in Cathedral Village since 1983.

title: Special H.U.D. Prosecutor Is Requested by Democrats
description: Democrats on the House Judiciary Committee today formally requested appointment of an independent prosecutor to investigate allegations of political favoritism and perjury against the former Housing Secretary, Samuel R. Pierce Jr. The request by 19 Democrats provoked a sharp response from Attorney General Dick Thornburgh, who accused two leading Democrats on the Judiciary Committee of introducing ''partisan politics'' into Federal investigations of the Department of Housing and Urban Development.

title: Light Trading in Treasury Issues
description: Prices of Treasury securities rose modestly in light trading yesterday, as dealers awaited the release today of employment data for October.

title: The U.N. Today
description: General Assembly SPECIAL POLITICAL COMMITTEE - 10 A.M. and 3 P.M. ECONOMIC AND FINANCIAL COMMITTEE - 3 p.M. SOCIAL, HUMANITARIAN AND CULTURAL COMMITTEE - 3 P.M. ADMINISTRATIVE AND BUDGETARY COMMITTEE - 10 A.M. and 3 P.M. LEGAL COMMITTEE - 10 A.M.

title: In Bias Settlement, Gay Man Can Take Companion on Trip
description: A homosexual account executive who won a company-paid vacation for two in Hawaii has settled a discrimination complaint against his company, which would not allow him to take his male companion.

title: Drama in Virginia
description: He's a moderate Democrat believed to be running ahead of a conservative Republican opponent who has relied heavily on ''negative'' advertising.

title: Washington at Work; National Security Adviser Redefines the Role, Drawing Barrage of Criticism
description: According to the equation often attributed to the political scientist Richard E. Neustadt, physical proximity to the President equals power. That should make Brent Scowcroft the most powerful of George Bush's foreign policy lieutenants.

title: In Westchester, 2 Moderates Battle for Top County Post
description: In the race for Westchester County executive, voters will choose between two moderate candidates who diverge dramatically in their assessment of Westchester and their approach to government.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Entertainment Weekly Begins Trade Campaign
description: Entertainment Weekly magazine introduced its trade advertising campaign yesterday with a series of ads aimed at readers who are starved for sheer unadulterated fun.

title: Conseco Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included gains from the sale of investments of $12.6 million, or $1.63 a fully diluted share, for the quarter and $15.1 million, or $1.90 a fully diluted share for the 9 months. c-Included gains from the sale of investments of $1 million, or 9 cents a fully diluted share and $4.5 million, or 41 cents a fully diluted share for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. Share earnings are fully diluted.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; New Director Seeks to End Ogilvy Slump
description: FOR Bill Hamilton, taking the creative helm of Ogilvy & Mather/New York is a bit like managing the New York Yankees.

title: Wegener Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 1
description: b-Included an accounting adjustment loss of $334,000. c-Net income

title: Eastman Kodak reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: b-Included a $350 million charge for restructuring costs in the second quarter, which reduced net earnings by $227 million, or 70 cents a share.

title: Diner's Journal
description: Brunch at Metro

title: Bishops Emphasize Ethics in Ban on Condoms
description: To the Editor:

title: Prime Computer Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: b-Included aftertax expense of $92.3 million for both periods from restructuring of operations after the acquisition of 79 percent of Prime Computer Inc. by DR Acquisition Corp., an affiliate of J.H. Whitney & Co. The 9 months also included aftertax expense of $4.4 million associated with the MAI Basic Four Inc. tender offer, a charge of $19.3 million for reimbursement of expenses to DR Acquisition in accord with the merger agreement and additional legal fees and costs, an extraordinary gain of $1.5 million, or 3 cents a share, from the open market purchase of $9.5 million face value of Computervision convertible debentures. c-Net income d-Included aftertax expense of $4.5 million for anticipated restructuring associated with Computervision merger, a cumulative benefit of $6 million, or 12 cents a share, from change in accounting for income taxes, a non-recurring charge of $5.1 million for withdrawal of the MXCL 5 minisupercomputer from the market.

title: A Neighborhood Wavers In Its Liberal Tradition
description: The Upper West Side of Manhattan is likely to support David N. Dinkins, the Democratic mayoral candidate, in next week's election, but not necessarily with the passionate embrace that might once have been expected from this traditionally liberal neighborhood.

title: Pact in Nicaragua: U.S. Resists Too
description: Although the United States has vehemently denounced President Daniel Ortega Saavedra of Nicaragua for ending a cease-fire and violating regional peace accords, the United States itself has resisted key provisions of those accords.

title: Integrated Plans to Sell Units for $170 Million
description: Integrated Resources Inc., the burdened financial services concern, said today that it had agreed to sell several large businesses to Broad Inc., a competitor based here, for about $170 million.

title: Against Dinkins and For Giuliani
description: LEAD: The ultimate analysis of David Dinkins, a flawed phenomenon wrought by the times, should be written with a pen dipped in tears of regret, rather than the hot blood or bitter bile of racism.

title: 3 Designers: Casual to Fanciful
description: Louis Dell'Olio took a trip to Pompeii. Bob Mackie recalled a visit to Las Vegas when he was very young and impressionable. Mary McFadden was impressed by an exhibition of Surrealist paintings. These are the sources credited yesterday by the three designers for their spring collections. The result: disparate clothes, casual to fanciful.

title: Homeward Bound
description: Jimmy Carson, who left the Edmonton Oilers two and a half weeks ago and demanded a trade to a United States-based team, got his wish yesterday when he was sent to the Detroit Red Wings, his hometown team, in a six-player deal.

title: A Modern Greek Tragedy
description: LEAD: As Greece's parliamentary elections draw near, the former Prime Minister, Andreas Papandreou, faces a series of criminal charges ranging from bribery to receiving stolen funds. Mr. Papandreou, who remains in control of his Socialist Party, could well be convicted if preliminary reports prepared by parliamentary investigators withstand the scrutiny of defense lawyers.

title: 'Sid Caesar' to Close
description: ''Sid Caesar and Company: Does Anybody Know What I'm Talking About,'' a comedy revue with music, directed by Martin Charnin, will close after the Sunday matinee at the Golden Theater, 252 WEst 45th Street, The show will have run for five regular performances and six previews.

title: Two at Knoll Sued Over Sale of Subsidiary
description: The United Technologies Corporation and Gibbons Green van Amerongen, a New York investment firm, yesterday filed a lawsuit against two top executives of Knoll International Holdings Inc., the office products company, seeking damages of $173 million.

title: Pitchman-Pundit: Koch Looks at '90 and Beyond
description: In what is becoming a lucrative tradition for former officials and politicians, Mayor Edward I. Koch will join the lecture circuit when he leaves office in January, charging substantial fees for opinions that he has been dispensing for free for almost 12 years.

title: ABUSE CASE GOES TO CALIFORNIA JURY
description: After more than two and half years and $15 million, the McMartin Preschool child-molesting trial, the nation's longest-running criminal proceeding, went to the jury today.

title: Rodman & Renshaw reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
BRIEFS
description: * Air Midwest Inc., Wichita, Kan., said its board had authorized merger talks with Mesa Airlines Inc., Farmington, N.M.

title: No Damage but Jarred Nerves From Aftershock in California
description: An aftershock of last month's deadly earthquake jolted Northern California on Wednesday night, but the authorities said today that the only harm appeared to be more jangled nerves.

title: Unican Security Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Figures are in Canadian funds.

title: Jospeh Oxenhorn, 75, Educator and Author
description: Joseph Oxenhorn, a teacher, textbook author and principal in the New York City school system for 30 years, died of prostate cancer Sunday at the Berkshire Medical Center in Pittsfield, Mass. He was 75 years old and lived in North Hillsdale, N.Y.

title: Pre-Paid Legal Services reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss c-Net income and included an accounting adjustment gain of $1,139,000, or 13 cents a share.

title: QSR Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 17
description: b-Included $90,000 and $202,000 of other income for the latest and year- ago quarters, respectively, and the latest quarter also included $65,000 in start-up costs for Mr. Submarine. The company was formerly known as Taco Viva Inc.

title: Review/Music; Singing Poulenc and Faure As a Tribute to the French
description: With its resident boys choir, fine organ, sure leadership and ample musical budget, St. Thomas Church on Fifth Avenue continues to present some of the most appealing liturgical concerts in New York. Tuesday night, the program was an all-French tribute to the bicentennial of the French Revolution, consisting of Poulenc's a cappella Mass in G (1937), his Concerto for organ, string orchestra and timpani (1938) and the 1893 version of Faure's Requiem.

title: Review/Theater; 'Meet Me in St. Louis': Movie Brought to Stage
description: It's hard not to feel stirred when the lights dim in a Broadway theater, the curtain rises on a picture-postcard frontcloth, and a confident pit band splashes through an overture heralding ''The Trolley Song,'' ''The Boy Next Door'' and ''Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas.'' Do these songs affect us because their authors, Hugh Martin and Ralph Blane, touched something eternal in the American character when they wrote them for the M-G-M film musical ''Meet Me in St. Louis'' during the wartime of 1944? Or is it because the songs were first delivered by Judy Garland, that difficult cultural icon about whom our complicated feelings remain forever unresolved?

title: Plant Workers Rebuff Chrysler
description: Hourly workers at the Chrysler Corporation mini-van plant in St. Louis overwhelmingly rejected an unusual company-sponsored proposal for a four-day workweek intended to increase production by 20 percent. The rejection is a blow to

title: Windmere Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago revenues included about $8.6 million in the quarter and about $26.3 million in the 9 months from the Save-Way Beauty Supply stores sold by Windmere in October 1988. The company said year-ago quarter results included $717,000, or 5 cents a share, from non-recurring income; year-ago 9 months figures included $1,115,000, or 8 cents a share, from non-recurring income. The company said that effective January 1989, sales and other operating values, including minority interest, reflected the consolidated results of Durable Electrical Metal Factory Ltd.

title: Wackenhut Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
Sears Studies Alternatives To Sale of Chicago Tower
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company may not sell its headquarters tower here after all, the company said today.

title: Ruth D. Coleman, Photographer, 85
description: Ruth Doloboff Coleman, a photographer and former president of the Pictorial Photographers of America, died of cancer Wednesday at Calvary Hospital in the Bronx. She was 85 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Jets to Face Their Nemesis Again
description: It's a quirk of sports. Steve Grogan says he can't explain it. Joe Walton contends it's one of those things that happen in ball games, ''like a 30-game winner who has trouble with one particular batter.''

title: A Black Candidate in Virginia Runs for Office, Not History
description: The paradox of Virginia's hard-fought gubernatorial election is that L. Douglas Wilder has worked as hard as he can to avoid any direct discussion of race in his campaign just as the nation, and even the world, look to the possibility that he will become the first black ever elected governor of an American state.

title: Review/Film; Double Bill Tracing Evolution Of Spike Lee
description: ''I can't see where anything is going to be any different,'' says one resident of Bedford-Stuyvesant during the shooting of ''Do the Right Thing.'' Says another, ''It's not going to put a policeman on every corner or fix the stoplights.''

title: Sym-Tek Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Ipalco Enterprises reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Columbia First Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: O'Connor's Agonizing Search for Law Clerks
description: In a world where she is called upon to make judgments that affect the course of constitutional law, Justice Sandra Day O'Connor has provided a rare insight into a different sort of arduous decision: selecting law clerks.

title: Monarch Airlines
description: British Aerospace P.L.C. said Monarch Airlines had ordered two Airbus Industrie A330's with options on two more. No value was given for the order. Monarch will receive the aircraft in the spring of 1996 and is the first British airline to select the aircraft. It placed an order for four Airbus A300-600's in February and will receive the first of these aircraft next spring. British Aerospace is a member of the Airbus Consortium, together with Messerschmitt-Bolkow-Blohm of West Germany, Aerospatiale of France and Casa of Spain.

title: Thomas Cheeger, 87, Ex-Structural Engineer
description: Thomas Cheeger, a retired structural engineer, died Sunday at a nursing home in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 87 years old and lived in West Palm Beach.

title: Lawmaker Seeks Benefits Restraint
description: In the first sign of a Congressional backlash, an influential lawmaker proposed a measure today to help Congress resist pressures from the elderly for more Government benefits.

title: Gulf States Utilities Co reports earnings for 12mo Sept 30
description: b-Included after-tax writeoffs of $55 million. c-Net income

title: Sporting Life Inc reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Traffic Alert
description: Because of the New York City Marathon, these streets will be closed to traffic in Manhattan for much of Sunday morning and afternoon: First Avenue from 59th Street to the Willis Avenue Bridge, Fifth Avenue from 136th Street to 102d Street and Central Park South from Fifth Avenue to Broadway. In addition, some traffic lanes on the Queensboro Bridge, the Willis Avenue Bridge, the Madison Avenue Bridge and the Verrazano Narrows Bridge will be closed.

title: American Water Works Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Symbolics Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
Southwestern Energy Co reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-New loss

title: Review/Art; 'Amerika' by Tim Rollins and .O.S.
description: Horns aplenty is an apt if corny label for the exhibition of ''Amerika'' paintings by Tim Rollins the Kids of Survival (or K.O.S.), that has just opened at the Dia Art Foundation. That aptness is evident after experiencing the rich, brassy cacophony of the 13 big horizontal paintings in the show.

title: K-H Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss of $252,197,000 from discontinued operations, which included loss on disposal of discontinued operations of $249,466,000. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $7,122,000 for the quarter and $15,218,000 for the 9 months. The year-ago periods were restated for the presentation of discontinued operations.

title: Threads of Irish Politics Woven Into Mayoral Race
description: If it were not for a few minutes of gunfire on Antrim Road in Belfast, Northern Ireland, nine years ago, the name Joseph Patrick Thomas Doherty would mean very little in New York.

title: Management Team To Head McKesson
description: The McKesson Corporation, a distributor of drugstore products, named a new management team yesterday after the recent resignation of Thomas W. Field Jr., who had been president, chairman and chief executive.

title: ACID RAIN MEASURE WOULD DIVIDE COST
description: To break a deadlock that has stalled action on the Bush Administration's clean air bill, the chairman of the House Energy Committee today proposed a new way to finance the multibillion-dollar cleanup of the pollution that causes acid rain.

title: Mary McCarthy Service
description: A memorial service for the writer Mary McCarthy is to be held on Wednesday from 2 to 4 P.M. at the Pierpont Morgan Library, 29 East 36th Street. Miss McCarthy's husband, James West, and her publisher, William Jovanovich, are to officiate, and there are to be readings from her work. Miss McCarthy died of cancer on Oct. 25 at the age of 77.

title: 20th Century Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Figures for 1988 have been restated to conform to FASB 97.

title: Review/Cabaret; Ben Vereen Brings Back His Pop-Soul With Swivel
description: With Broadway credits that include ''Hair,'' ''Jesus Christ Superstar'' and ''Pippin,'' Ben Vereen epitomizes a 1970's genre that might be called Broadway soul. In applying traditional show business flash and polish to a mixture of show tunes and rock and soul material, he refined a pop-soul style that was not too raw to please Broadway audiences but also was never funky enough to make him a recording star.

title: Strike Begins to Squeeze Nynex
description: A three-month telephone strike by two unions representing 60,000 workers of the Nynex Corporation is beginning to hurt the regional Bell telephone company's bottom line, Nynex officials and telephone industry analysts say.

title: New Disney Attraction
description: A new health and fitness pavilion opened this week at Disney World's Epcot Center, featuring a ''thrill ride'' through the human body and gadgets that tell visitors how healthy they are. The $90 million ''Wonders of Life'' attraction is the ninth pavilion in the Future World section of Epcot Center. Officials of the Walt Disney Company also announced plans for two new hotels in the region: a plantation-style resort called Dixie Landings and a New Orleans-style hotel called Port Orleans.

title: Cigna Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company said the 1989 results included a gain on sale of the Horace Mann companies of $81 million ($1.03 a share). These results also included net realized investment gains of $35 million (44 cents a share) and net realized investment losses of $1 million in the third quarters of 1989 and 1988, respectively. For 9 months, the net realized investment gains were $53 million (67 cents a share) in 1989 and $1 million (1 cent a share) in 1988.

title: Television Technology reports earnings for Year to June 30
description: b-Net income

title: Israel Warms a Bit to U.S. Plan on Talks
description: The Israeli Government indicated possible readiness today to accept the American plan for Israeli-Palestinian discussions in Cairo after Secretary of State James A. Baker 3d offered essentially minor modifications.

title: Doctors Give Jogger Chance of Full Recovery
description: The jogger who was raped, beaten and left for dead in Central Park on April 19 has made a ''remarkable recovery'' and is now given a chance of recovering virtually all her mental and physical capacities, one of her doctors said yesterday.

title: Dismissal Found Unjust
description: A Federal jury in Columbia, S.C., agreed yesterday that Bob Marcum, former athletic director at the University of South Carolina, had been dismissed unjustly, and awarded Marcum nearly $250,000 in damages.

title: United Insurance reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Review/Film; Boardrooms and Bedrooms: Preoccupations of 'Dealers'
description: Early in ''Dealers,'' a new English film, there are shards of dialogue to suggest that it might originally have been intended as a satire of the world of big-time finance. The principal setting is the London branch of an American bank named Whitney Paine, whose employees, needless to say, are all in emotional need. Some of the initial dialogue is also funny.

title: Sounds Around Town
description: Drumming, Loudly

title: Canadian Tire reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,368,000 and $3,059,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: H. M. Margolis, 80, Industrialist
description: Henry Melville Margolis, a lawyer who branched out to become an industrialist, restaurateur, Broadway producer and philanthropist, died at New York Hospital yesterday after suffering a heart attack while attending a function at Lincoln Center.

title: Review/Dance; Maguy Marin Mocks the French Bicentennial Hoopla
description: In a year that left France buried up to its cockades in celebrations of the 200th anniversary of the French Revolution, the choreographer Maguy Marin has come up with an anti-commemorative theater piece.

title: Superior Teletec Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 24
Chemical Bank Certificates Are Priced to Yield 8.838%
description: A $350 million offering of asset-backed certificates by Chemical Bank was priced yesterday through an underwriting group headed by Chemical Securities Inc. The transaction is the first such asset-backed deal to be handled by an underwriting group comprising only banks.

title: Former Fingerhut Chief Will Return to His Post
description: The Primerica Corporation said yesterday that its mail order subisidiary, the Fingerhut Companies, would be headed once more by Ted Deikel, who guided the company to its original success.

title: NVR L.P. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Virginia Beach Federal Savngs reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included pre-tax gain of $10,099,000 on sale of stock.

title: Japan Trade Surplus Down
description: Japan's current account surplus, which measures trade in both goods and services, fell in September for the seventh straight month, tumbling 22 percent from a year earlier, to $5.91 billion, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: Judges Honor Kaufman's 40 Years on Bench
description: Judge Irving R. Kaufman, a senior judge on the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit in Manhattan, who is recognized for his support of First Amendment rights, was honored Tuesday on his 40th anniversary on the Federal bench by a gathering of his fellow judges and former clerks.

title: Productivity Rose 2.1% In 3d Quarter
description: Productivity in the nonfarm sector of the nation's economy increased in the third quarter, but the improvement was overshadowed by other data suggesting that a slump in manufacturing was far from over and that wage inflation remained stubborn.

title: Patrick Petroleum reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Review/Art; The Real Canaletto Routs The Fakes and Imitations
description: For many visitors, the exhibition of 85 paintings and 42 drawings by Canaletto that has just opened at the Metropolitan Museum of Art will come as a wonderful surprise.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Switch by Quaker State
description: The Quaker State Corporation yesterday switched its regional advertising and sales promotion to Grey Advertising, in a consolidation of its accounts at the agency. A spokeswoman for Grey said the new business would add at least $5 million to Quaker State's billings with the agency, which were about $15 million last year. The incumbent agency was Fahlgren & Swink of Cincinnati.

title: New England Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Nets Set for Real Games After Grueling Workouts
description: After a month of hard labor under Bill Fitch, the Nets are thankful the regular season is beginning. Training camp was no picnic.

title: TV Celebrity Joins Presidential Race in Brazil
description: With Brazilian presidential elections two weeks away, one of the country's most popular television personalities has suddenly entered the race, and a public opinion poll shows that he could win.

title: Candidates Strive to Widen Support As They Get Ready for First Debate
description: Rudolph W. Giuliani and David N. Dinkins sought yesterday to widen their appeal to voters - Mr. Giuliani to women and Mr. Dinkins to veterans -as they prepared for the first debate of the New York City mayoral campaign and broadcast new television commercials.

title: Coastal Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
University Will Preserve Park That Was Scene of Protests
description: The University of California at Berkeley, faced with community opposition to its plans to build student housing on a park near the campus, has announced that it will preserve the land as open space.

title: Bishops Emphasize Ethics in Ban on Condoms; Taking the Long View
description: To the Editor:

title: Union Curbs an Agent
description: Jerry Kapstein, one of baseball's earliest and wealthiest agents, yesterday became the first agent to be decertified by the Players Association. The union took the action because of Kapstein's role in the effort to sell the San Diego Padres. Joan Kroc, the Padres' owner, who is Kapstein's mother-in-law, has Kapstein as the sales agent for the club.

title: What the Mayoral Candidates Aren't Saying
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place; Compaq Sales Dip Alarms Investors
description: COMPAQ COMPUTER is widely expected to introduce a bold desktop computer that can match the speed and power of more costly minicomputers made by Digital Equipment and others.

title: Piniella to Manage Reds, Newspaper Says
description: Lou Piniella has agreed to a two-year contract to manage the Cincinnati Reds, according to a published report.

title: ABC News Plans to Change 'Prime Time Live' Format
description: The executive producer of the ABC News program ''Prime Time Live'' is planning to adjust its format to smooth out some ''wrinkles'' and to respond to the frustration of one of its anchors, Sam Donaldson, who says the program has ''not always played to my strengths.''

title: To Woo Soviet Jews to Israel, A $2 Billion Drive Is Mounted
description: The Jewish Agency announced a campaign today to raise $2 billion by 1993 to help attract Soviet Jews to Israel and absorb them into society with new housing, education and job training programs.

title: Housing Plan Dominates Yonkers Race
description: One year after Yonkers was almost bankrupted by contempt fines when four City Councilmen refused to comply with a housing desegregation plan, the entire seven-member Council is up for election in a vote widely seen as a referendum on the plan.

title: COMPLACENCY SEEN IN BATTLE ON AIDS
description: A World Health Organization official said today that a ''dangerous complacency'' threatens to cripple efforts to counter an expected tenfold increase in AIDS cases over the next decade.

title: Brascan Ltd reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Cardinals Are a Threat To Giants
description: Coach Bill Parcells insists history has nothing to do with football. But now, as his high-flying Giants prepare to play the lower-flying Phoenix Cardinals Sunday in Tempe, Ariz., he is bringing up history.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption yesterday about a conference of Colombian journalists on the erosion of press freedoms in their country described a panel member incorrectly. Enrique Zileri is a Peruvian; he represented the International Press Institute.

title: Weatherford International reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an accounting adjustment gain of $526,000, or 5 cents a share, representing cumulative effect on prior years of a change in an accounting principle. Nine-month results were negatively impacted by increased interest expense of about $1,197,000 due primarily to higher U.S. prime interest rates.

title: Slump Accompanies Islanders on the Road
description: In the first period of tonight's Islanders' 5-2 loss to the Penguins, after Mark Recchi scored to give Pittsburgh a 2-0 lead, Glenn Healy fished the puck out of the net, appeared to drop it toward the ice and miss an attempted punt.

title: Pacificorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Eason Warned
description: The Jets' management, frustrated and angry over Tony Eason's refusal to join the club after they acquired him on waivers from New England, told the quarterback today that he would be suspended without pay for the season if he did not report by next Tuesday.

title: Metallurgical Mystery in Crash That Killed 112
description: Investigators looking into the crash of a United Airlines DC-10 jet here last July have now discounted a possibility that at first stunned and alarmed them: that because of confusion over a serial number a flawed piece of metal was used in the engine that failed.

title: USA Bancorp Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Quotation of the Day
description: ''This is a hopeful message, an important message for the American people to understand. You don't have to be a marathoner. In fact, you get much more benefit out of being just a bit more active. For example, going from being sedentary to walking briskly for a half hour several days a week can drop your risk dramatically.'' - Dr. Carl Caspersen of the Federal Centers for Disease Control. [ A1:4. ]

title: Transactions
description: BASKETBALL ALTANTA (NBA) - Waived Duane Ferrell and Mitch McMullen, forwards, and Haywoode Workman, guard. BOSTON (NBA) - Placed Michael Smith, forward, on the injured list. CLEVELAND (NBA) - Placed Larry Nance and Chris Dudley, forwards, and Brad Daugherty, center, on the injured list. DENVER (NBA) - Named Jon Spoelstra president and general manager. GOLDEN STATE (NBA) - Waived Tom Tolbert, forward. HOUSTON (NBA) - Waived Tom Domako, forward. INDIANA (NBA) - Placed Calvin Natt, forward, on the injured list. LOS ANGELES CLIPPERS (NBA) -Claimed Andre Turner, guard, on waivers from Charlotte. Placed Jay Edwards, guard, and Danny Manning, forward, on the injured list. MIAMI (NBA) - Placed Mark Plansky, forward, on the injured list. MILWAUKEE (NBA) - Waived Delaney Rudd, guard. KNICKS (NBA) - Placed Kiki Vandeweghe, forward, on the injured list. ORLANDO (NBA) - Placed Morlon Wiley, guard, on the injured list. PHILADELPHIA (NBA) - Waived Kevin Holmes and Jim Rowinski, forwards. Placed Bob Thornton, forward, on the injured list.

title: Winning Combination From N.B.A. Computer
description: After being fed reams of information about arena availabilities and the other factors that go into making up the 1,107-game National Basketball Association schedule, the computer came up with a dandy for the opening of the season tonight.

title: Bergeron Disappointed In Return to Garden
description: The clock had run out, but there appeared to be no end to Michel Bergeron's disappointment. He stood behind the bench in an emptying Madison Square Garden, his spirits sunk, his chin buried in his chest, his eyes staring at the ground.

title: Ex-Nursing Home Aide Gets Life Term in 5 Patient Killings
description: A former nursing home aide was sentenced to life in prison without parole today for smothering five patients in a lover's pact with another woman.

title: Restaurants
description: Hatsuhana

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: HOCKEY Sabres 4, Canadiens 3: Pierre Turgeon had a goal and two assists to lead Buffalo in Montreal. Turgeon, who set up Mike Hartman's tie-breaking goal midway through the second period, jumped on a giveaway by Russ Courtnall and put a wrist shot past Patrick Roy 10 minutes 35 seconds into the third period to give the Sabres a 4-2 lead. Chris Chelios scored for Montreal with 1:38 remaining, but the Canadiens were unable to get the tying goal past Clint Malarchuk.(AP) Bruins 5, Kings 4: Bob Sweeney scored at 1:43 of overtime in Boston after his teammate Rob Cimetta tied the score with 38 seconds left. Sweeney took a pass from Ray Bourque and scored on a backhander from in close. (AP) Blackhawks 4, North Stars 3: Doug Wilson scored 18 seconds into overtime as Chicago overcame a three-goal deficit to beat visiting Minnesota. The victory was the Blackhawks' 10th, most in the N.H.L. They are tied with the Rangers for the most points, 21.(AP) TENNIS McEnroe and Becker Gain: John McEnroe got fired up after a penalty point and advanced to the quarterfinals of the Paris Open yesterday, beating Horst Skoff of Austria, 7-6, 6-0. Boris Becker of West Germany edged Guy Forget of France, 6-7, 6-4, 7-6, in a second-round match. Alberto Mancini of Argentina was eliminated by Wally Masur of Australia, 4-6, 6-3, 6-0.(AP)

title: Money Fund Assets Up
description: The assets of the nation's 476 money market mutual funds increased by $2.19 billion, to $359.71 billion, for the week that ended Wednesday, the Investment Company Institute said yesterday. The assets of the 143 institutional funds decreased by $6.7 million, to $84.82 billion. The assets of the 236 general-purpose funds were up by $750.5 million, to $117.66 billion. The 97 broker-dealer funds increased by $1.45 billion, to $157.24 billion, the institute said.

title: KLM-Northwest
description: KLM Royal Dutch said it was reducing its stake in NWA Inc., the parent of Northwest Airlines, to $150 million, from $300 million, in compliance with rules of the United States Department of Transportation. KLM also said it had agreed to sell 75 percent of its wholly owned Golden Tulip Internatinal hotel group for an undisclosed sum to a group consisting of the Multi Development Corporation and Ravast Beheer N.V., both of the Netherlands, and Toga Hotels-Helfer Holding S.A. of Switzerland.

title: Home National Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Unions, Civil Libertarians and S.E.C. All Support RICO Reform
description: To the Editor:

Tickets: $10, $15 and $25; proceeds will benefit the Y's nursery school. Information: 427-6000. FALL NATURE WALK, a visit through woods and gardens to a pond and beehives, directed by John Mancuso, a naturalist, 2 P.M. Sunday, at the Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road off Central Avenue, Scarsdale, N.Y. Contributions: children, $1; adults, $2. Information: (914) 723-3470. BOB ZENTZ FOLK CONCERT, a program of guitar and hammered dulcimer by Mr. Zentz, a singer and songwriter, 8:30 P.M. tomorrow, at the Stamford (Conn.) Museum and Nature Center, 39 Scofieldtown Road. Information: (203) 322-1646. BALLET HISPANICO, a program of classic Spanish flamenco, Latin American and traditional Caribbean dances, for children 6 and older, 1 P.M. tomorrow, at the Triplex, 199 Chambers Street. Tickets: $6. Information: 618-1980. ''CHILDREN OF THE WORLD,'' a puppet show by O. T. Zappo, 11 A.M. and 1 P.M. tomorrow and Sunday, at the Puppet Playhouse, 555 East 90th Street. Tickets: $3.50. Reservations: 369-8890. ''MERLIN,'' a magic-and-comedy show with Jack Adams, presented by Theaterworks/USA, 12:30 P.M. tomorrow and 10:30 A.M. and 12:30 P.M. Sunday, at the Promenade Theater, Broadway and 76th Street. Tickets, $12 and $15. Reservations: 677-5959.
