description: As Peru's municipal elections approached, Ricardo Belmont commiserated with listeners of his radio and television talk show about the garbage in Lima's streets, the rising crime, the shortages of food and the ineptitude of traditional politicians.

title: K Mart Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 25
Mail Boxes Etc reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: Share earnings are adjusted for a 3-for-2 stock split in October.

title: Maxwell's Profit Falls 34.8%
description: The Maxwell Communication Corporation, the British publishing concern that owns Macmillan Inc., reported today that its net profit fell 34.8 percent in the first half of its fiscal year.

title: Guida to Be Co-Anchor Of Channel 4's 'Live at 5'
description: Tony Guida, a Channel 4 reporter who has specialized in city politics, has been named a co-anchor of ''Live at Five,'' the station's early-evening news program. Mr. Guida will replace Jack Cafferty, who announced last week that he would move to Channel 5 to become the anchor of a new late-night news program. Mr. Guida will join Sue Simmons in heading the weekday program.

title: A Judge Delays Rules On Tenant Succession
description: A state judge today issued a temporary order preventing the state's housing agency from enforcing new rules that would give unrelated people the right of succession in rent-stabilized apartments.

title: Seattle Voters Reject Busing
description: A voter initiative asking the school board to stop busing students for racial balance was declared approved today after absentee ballots were counted. The initiative promises that city sales tax money would be used for ''magnet'' programs aimed at achieving integration voluntarily. It has no effect unless the school board adopts it.

title: Endowment Head Explains Withdrawal of Art Grant
description: John E. Frohnmayer, the new chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts, said yesterday that he regretted describing as ''political'' his reason for withdrawing endowment sponsorship from a New York art show about AIDS.

title: Times to Begin A Fax Synopsis
description: The New York Times Company announced yesterday that in January it plans to begin transmitting a synopsis of The New York Times through facsimile machines to corporations and travelers in the Far East.

title: Oak Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $2,203,000, $7.1 million of nonrecurring expense, and a $970,000 gain on sale of real property. c-Net income and included $5.7 million and $9.2 million of nonrecurring income for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: North Star Universal Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $2,500,000. c-Included losses from discontinued operations of $90,000 and $104,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. d-Net income

title: Scientists Test Radical Accelerator Technology
description: SCIENTISTS probing the mysteries of matter have reached a barrier almost as daunting as any created by nature: particle accelerators have grown so large that they are becoming too expensive to build. But new research suggests that radically innovative technology could bring the size, and therefore the cost, of a future generation of ultrapowerful accelerators down to an acceptable level without sacrificing results.

title: Republic Pictures Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Tierco Group Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Insurers vs. Doctors: A Software Battleground
description: New computer software products using techniques developed by artificial intelligence researchers are helping a growing number of employers and insurers to audit some of the 1.5 billion doctor and hospital bills submitted each year for insurance payment.

title: Boston Journal; Future of the Common: New Building or a Tree
description: How best to use the Boston Common, the 48-acre green preserve at the heart of this city steeped in history, is the subject of vigorous debate these days.

title: Oil Industry Calls for Opening Reserves
description: The executive who will lead the oil industry's battle in Washington against tighter regulations said today that the United States could not remain an economic power if it prevented the energy industry's search and development of promising reserve fields.

title: Space Shuttle Flight Delayed
description: The launching of the space shuttle Discovery, which had been scheduled for next Monday, will be delayed at least two days because of potential short-circuits in the wiring assemblies of the two booster rockets. The National Aeronautics and Space Administration said technicians today were removing four integrated electronics assemblies, two from each of the boosters, and taking them to the manufacturer for inspection. The agency said the launching would occur no earlier than Nov. 22. The potential problem showed up in prelaunching tests.

title: Bombing Attempt in London
description: A bomb apparently intended for a British general was found under a car, and the police said today that it appeared to be the work of the Irish Republican Army. The bomb was placed under the wrong car and fell off because it was not attached properly, the authorities said.

title: Reviews/Dance; Premieres by Blue Mercury
description: Loris Anthony Beckles, the artistic director of the Blue Mercury Dancing Company, can create strong choreographic images. In ''Returns,'' a solo in the program the troupe presented Sunday afternoon at the Pace Downtown Theater, Tyrone Aiken began by moving tentatively, as if uncertain what fate had in store for him. Then he attempted to go through life with skips and swaggers, only to reel from the punches of invisible assailants. The changes in movement qualities were big and bold, and Mr. Aiken made them all clear.

title: 'Sesame Street' at 21: Taking Stock
description: The 5-year-olds who watched the first ''Sesame Street'' show in 1969 are now old enough to have Cookie Monsters of their own, but the debate that began with the first show continues today: Is television a good teacher?

title: Joseph Markle, Lawyer, 89
description: Joseph Markle, a lawyer and retired colonel in the Army, died of heart failure Monday at New York Hospital. He was 89 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Goal by Wells Sends Islanders to 6th Straight Loss
description: Ron Hextall, playing his first full game since last spring's Stanley Cup playoffs, survived several mistakes off his own goalie stick tonight and helped the Philadelphia Flyers to a 5-4 victory over the Islanders at Nassau Coliseum.

title: School Busing Opposed In an Election in Seattle
description: A count of absentee ballots showed Monday that the voters narrowly passed a measure opposing the busing of students for racial balance, but the head of the Seattle School Board says he is not sure whether the measure will be enacted.

title: Real Estate; Plan to Ease The Transfer Of Air Rights
description: THE New York City Planning Department has proposed to expand the area in mid-Manhattan to which unused development rights from Grand Central Terminal could be transferred for future building projects.

title: Mr. Kemp Faces Up to the Homeless
description: Many Americans look away when confronted with homeless people on the streets. So does the Federal Government. President Reagan went so far as to declare that Washington had no responsibility because so many of them were homeless ''by choice.''

title: B.C. Bancorp reports earnings for Year to Oct 31
description: b-Included extraordinary credits of $4,511,000, or 13 cents a share, for the latest year and $4,514,000, or 13 cents a share, for the year-earlier period. The bank said the special gain in the latest period is mainly from a tax credit. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Ex-F.B.I. Agent to Be Tried A Third Time on Spy Charges
description: A Federal judge has set May 15 for the third trial of a former F.B.I. agent who is accused of selling documents to a Soviet agent.

title: 30-Year Bonds Sold at 7.87% Yield
description: The Treasury auctioned 30-year bonds at an average yield of 7.87 percent yesterday.

title: Review/Dance; The Joffrey Lets Loose In 'Trinity'
description: Gerald Arpino's ''Trinity'' is not a transcendent experience in ballet-going. But this signature work of the Joffrey Ballet repertory gives its dancers a chance to let loose in fast-moving, exuberant dance that seldom fails to excite the audience. And the five dancers who moved into new roles in a performance of the ballet by the Joffrey on Saturday afternoon at City Center lived up fully to its possibilities.

title: East German Health Crisis: Crucial Workers Flee
description: After waiting five and a half hours in the hallway of the emergency clinic at the St. Georg Hospital in Leipzig with her broken ankle in a fresh cast, Elfriede Volkel's mood was turning sour.

title: McCaw Gets Lin Financing
description: Nearly two dozen financial institutions have agreed to supply McCaw Cellular Communications with $3 billion to help it finance its offer for controlling interest in the Lin Broadcasting Corporation, McCaw said.

title: Prague Loosens Restrictions on Travel
description: Czechoslovakia's hard-line Government said today that it would markedly ease restrictions governing travel abroad early next year, probably on Jan. 1.

title: GORBACHEV URGES RESTRAINT BY WEST ON TURMOIL IN EAST
description: President Mikhail S. Gorbachev appealed today for restraint in response to the tumultuous changes in Eastern Europe, warning the West against gloating about the defeat of Communism or trying to ''export capitalism.''

title: Foreign Air Takeovers Benefit U.S. Travelers; British Restrictions
description: To the Editor:

title: Bush Meets G.O.P. Women on Abortion
description: President Bush met today with four Republican Congresswomen who support abortion rights, and afterward they said the President did not rule out the possibility of signing legislation allowing Federal financing of abortions for poor women in the cases or rape and incest.

title: Home Loan Banks Offering Securities
description: The Office of Finance of the Federal Home Loan Banks yesterday priced at par a four-part bond issue totaling $2.06 billion in fixed-rate securities through various securities dealers.

title: Nonaligned Nations Seek Total Nuclear Test Ban
description: Frustrated by the slow pace of nuclear disarmament, a group of nonaligned countries at this year's United Nations General Assembly is seeking to push the United States and Britain toward the Soviet position in favor of a total ban on nuclear testing.

title: Books of The Times; A Selection of the Best Short Stories of '89
description: The Best American Short Stories 1989 Selected by Margaret Atwood, with Shannon Ravenal 341 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $17.95.

title: Perils for Police Stressed at First of 3 Funerals
description: The muffled drums were heard yesterday as the hearse carrying the body of Officer Gary C. Coe rolled slowly down Avenue R in Brooklyn and probably will be heard twice more this week.

title: Paramount Takes Write-Off On Publishing Operations
description: In an announcement that caught Wall Street by surprise, Paramount Communications Inc. said yesterday that it would take a $140 million pretax write-off against the earnings of its publishing operations in the fourth quarter of the fiscal year ended Oct. 31.

title: Leucadia National Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After income from discontinued operations of $1,606,000, or 12 cents a share, for the quarter and $5,056,000, or 38 cents a share, for the 9 months; the 9 months also included pre-tax gain of about $17,865,000 on sales of certain properties and units in a condominium project, a provision of about $3,575,000 for the restructuring of the trading stamps subsidiary's operations, and pre-tax net securities gains of $8,663,000. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $920,000, or 7 cents a share, for the quarter and $4,403,000, or 34 cents a share, for the 9 months; the 9 months also was after a loss of $2.4 million reflecting cumulative effect of a change in accounting for income taxes resulting from the adoption of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 96, and reflected pre-tax securities gains of $20,138,000.

title: Millionaire Hands Out Money to Help People Start Businesses
description: Barbara Erickson was in the unemployment line here recently when someone told her that a local millionaire was giving money to help people start small businesses.

title: Fires Force an End to Plans To Save Historic Farmhouse
description: Torn apart by drug-using squatters and plagued by a string of fires that culminated in a devastating blaze last week, a 250-year-old colonial farmhouse in Brooklyn was all but abandoned yesterday by the private preservation group that had tried to save it since 1981.

title: Congress Curbing Bush's Ability To Aid the Cambodian Guerrillas
description: Over the objections of the Bush Administration, Congress is imposing new restrictions on the President's ability to send weapons to non-Communist guerrillas in Cambodia, Congressional aides said today.

title: Italians Taking Sides Over Ghostwriting For a Nobel Winner
description: Is it possible? Can it be true? Eugenio Montale, one of the great poets of the century, the winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1975 and a noted literary and music critic, used a ghostwriter?
